abstracts.cdata!:
The Engineering Technical Education
            Quality Improvement Program Project aims at a systematic
            transformation of the technical education sub-sector, into a
            dynamic, demand-driven system, responsive to rapid economic,
            and technological developments. As such, the status of
            enrollment in Indian engineering education is reviewed, as
            well as the initiatives, and enabling mechanisms taken by
            the Government through the existing national policy, in
            providing education coverage for people with special needs,
            for women, and minorities. The project fully endorses such
            policy, and will support the cause of schedule castes (SCs)
            and schedule tribes (STs) students, in protecting the
            interests of indigenous persons, particularly that of the
            SC/STs. It is not envisaged that new institutions will be
            created, thus it is unlikely adverse impacts will affect
            STs' land rights. The quality of education for SC/STs
            will be enhanced, to meet international standards, focusing
            in particular, on popularizing technical education among
            SC/ST communities. The legal framework, and constitutional
            provisions allow for the advancement of socially, and
            educationally backward classes of citizens, and, promotes
            special care for the educational, and economic interests of
            the weaker sections of the population. Claims shall be taken
            into consideration, through grievance mechanisms due to
            discrimination against SC/STs candidates, through the
            judicial system, and by the National Commission for SC/STs,
            in addition, counseling and advisory services will also be provided.
